metadata.source: CWE Top 25 Most Dangerous Software Weaknesses

vulnerabilities.name: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: The software writes data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This typically occurs in native code (C/C++) used in mobile NDK libraries or browser engines.

detection_logic.static: Look for `strcpy`, `strcat`, `memcpy` without bounds checks in native libraries.
detection_logic.dynamic: Fuzzing input fields with oversized payloads.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Use memory-safe languages (Rust, Java, Swift) where possible. Use bounds-checking functions (e.g., `strncpy` instead of `strcpy`).

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description: The software does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page.
vulnerabilities.impact: Session hijacking, redirection to malicious sites, sensitive data theft.

detection_logic.static: Identify user input reflected in HTML without encoding/sanitization.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject `<script>alert(1)</script>` and SVG payloads into all inputs and check response body.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Context-aware output encoding. Use Content Security Policy (CSP). Use frameworks like React/Angular that auto-escape.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
vulnerabilities.description: The software constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes that input.
vulnerabilities.impact: Data breach, data loss, authentication bypass.

detection_logic.static: Search for string concatenation in SQL query strings.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject `' OR '1'='1` and monitor for database errors or true/false boolean responses.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Use Parameterized Queries (Prepared Statements) for all database access. Use ORMs (Hibernate, Entity Framework).

vulnerabilities.name: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: Referencing memory after it has been freed can cause a program to crash, use unexpected values, or execute code.

detection_logic.static: Advanced control flow analysis to track pointer lifecycles.
detection_logic.dynamic: Memory sanitizers (ASan) during runtime testing.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Set pointers to NULL after freeing them. Use smart pointers (e.g., `std::shared_ptr`) in C++.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
vulnerabilities.description: The software constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input, but it does not neutralize special elements that could modify the intended OS command.
vulnerabilities.impact: Full system compromise, remote code execution.

detection_logic.static: Identify calls to `system()`, `exec()`, `Runtime.exec()` using user input.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject time-delay commands (e.g., `; sleep 10`) and measure response time.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Avoid calling OS commands. Use library calls instead. If necessary, use `execve()` which separates arguments from the command.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

detection_logic.static: Check for missing validation logic on API endpoints.
detection_logic.dynamic: Send negative values, extremely long strings, and unexpected data types.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Input validation against a strict allowlist (positive validation). Validate length, type, syntax, and business rules.

vulnerabilities.name: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

detection_logic.static: Analyze array index calculations in C/C++ code.
detection_logic.dynamic: Fuzzing with varied input lengths.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Ensure index values are validated against buffer size. Use memory-safe languages.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
vulnerabilities.description: The software uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the software does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside of the restricted directory.
vulnerabilities.impact: Access to system files (`/etc/passwd`), application code disclosure.

detection_logic.static: Look for file operations using user input without sanitization.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject `../../../../etc/passwd` or `..\windows\win.ini` into URL parameters.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Do not use user input for filenames. Use indirect object references (IDs mapped to files). Validate that the resolved path starts with the expected base directory.

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: The web application does not sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request.
vulnerabilities.impact: Unintentional state change (password change, fund transfer).

detection_logic.static: Check for missing anti-CSRF tokens in form submissions.
detection_logic.dynamic: Replay a request without the CSRF token or with a modified Origin header.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Implement Anti-CSRF tokens (Synchronizer Token Pattern). Use SameSite cookie attribute (Strict/Lax).

vulnerabilities.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
vulnerabilities.description: The software allows the attacker to upload or transfer files of dangerous types that can be automatically processed within the product's environment.
vulnerabilities.impact: Remote Code Execution (uploading a PHP shell), defacement.

detection_logic.static: Check file upload logic for extension allowlisting.
detection_logic.dynamic: Attempt to upload `.php`, `.exe`, or `.html` files.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Validate file extensions against an allowlist. Validate MIME types. Store uploaded files outside the web root. Rename files upon upload.

vulnerabilities.name: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description: A NULL pointer dereference occurs when the application dereferences a pointer that it expects to be valid, but is NULL, typically causing a crash or exit.

detection_logic.static: Static analysis tools (Clang Static Analyzer).
detection_logic.dynamic: Fuzzing.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Check if a pointer is NULL before dereferencing. Handle exceptions gracefully.

vulnerabilities.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
vulnerabilities.description: The application deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently verifying that the resulting data will be valid.

detection_logic.static: Look for `ObjectInputStream.readObject`, `pickle.load`, `unserialize`.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject serialized objects containing malicious payloads (e.g., Ysoserial).

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Avoid native deserialization formats. Use JSON/XML. If necessary, sign the data or use strict type constraints during deserialization.

vulnerabilities.name: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: The software performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound, which often leads to logic errors or buffer overflows.
vulnerabilities.impact: Business logic bypass (negative prices), buffer overflow setup.

detection_logic.static: Analyze arithmetic operations on user-supplied integers.
detection_logic.dynamic: Send `MAX_INT`, `MAX_INT+1` values.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Check for overflow before performing arithmetic. Use BigInteger libraries.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the software does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

detection_logic.static: Review login flows and token validation logic.
detection_logic.dynamic: Brute force, credential stuffing, testing for session fixation.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). Strong password policies. Proper session management.

vulnerabilities.name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: The software contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data.

detection_logic.static: Scan code/binary for strings like `api_key`, `password`, `secret` using regex/entropy analysis.
detection_logic.dynamic: N/A (Primarily static).

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Store credentials in environment variables, KeyVaults, or secure storage (Android Keystore/iOS Keychain).

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Authorization
vulnerabilities.description: The software does not perform an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.
vulnerabilities.impact: IDOR (Insecure Direct Object Reference), Privilege Escalation.

detection_logic.static: Check API routes for missing middleware/decorators (e.g., `@login_required`).
detection_logic.dynamic: Access User B's resource using User A's session token.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) or Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) on every endpoint.

vulnerabilities.name: Incorrect Default Permissions
vulnerabilities.description: The software sets the permissions for a critical resource (file, directory, or database) to be broader than necessary.
vulnerabilities.impact: Data leakage to other apps or users.

detection_logic.static: Check AndroidManifest.xml for `exported=true` or file creation modes (e.g., `MODE_WORLD_READABLE`).
detection_logic.dynamic: Check file permissions at runtime.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Follow the Principle of Least Privilege. Set restrictive defaults (e.g., `chmod 600`).

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
vulnerabilities.description: The software does not perform any authentication for functionality that requires a provable user identity.

detection_logic.static: Review route definitions for unprotected critical paths.
detection_logic.dynamic: Browse directly to `/admin` or `/dashboard` without logging in.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Authenticate all users before allowing access to critical functions.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
vulnerabilities.description: Generic command injection, similar to CWE-78 but broader in scope involving interpreters.

detection_logic.static: Identify usage of `eval()`, `exec()`.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject interpreter-specific commands.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Avoid using user input in command strings.

vulnerabilities.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: The web server creates or makes an HTTP request to an arbitrary domain/IP based on user input.
vulnerabilities.impact: Access to internal metadata services (AWS/GCP), internal network scanning.

detection_logic.static: Analyze HTTP client calls using user-supplied URLs.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject `http://169.254.169.254` or `http://localhost` into URL parameters.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Validate and sanitizing target URLs. Use a strict allowlist of domains. Disable HTTP redirections.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerabilities.description: The software performs operations on a memory buffer, but it can read from or write to a memory location that is outside of the intended boundary of the buffer.

detection_logic.static: Source code analysis of buffer manipulation.
detection_logic.dynamic: Fuzzing.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Use safe libraries. Enforce boundary checks.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
vulnerabilities.description: The software constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.

detection_logic.static: Identify `eval()` usage in JS, Python, PHP.
detection_logic.dynamic: Inject language-specific payloads.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Do not use `eval()` functions. Isolate code execution environments.

vulnerabilities.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
vulnerabilities.description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

detection_logic.static: Check for logging of sensitive data (passwords, tokens). Check app cache settings.
detection_logic.dynamic: Analyze HTTP responses for stack traces or server version headers.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Classify data sensitivity. Mask sensitive data in logs. Disable verbose error messages in production.

vulnerabilities.name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
vulnerabilities.description: The software transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be sniffed by unauthorized actors.

detection_logic.static: Check for `http://` URLs in config or code. Check for `NSAppTransportSecurity` in iOS.
detection_logic.dynamic: Intercept network traffic and check for unencrypted data.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS/TLS for all communications. Use Certificate Pinning for mobile apps.

vulnerabilities.name: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.description: The software does not properly control the allocation and maintenance of a limited resource thereby enabling an actor to influence the amount of resources consumed, eventually leading to the exhaustion of available resources.

detection_logic.static: Check for loops bounded by user input.
detection_logic.dynamic: Send large payloads or rapid-fire requests.

vulnerabilities.mitigation: Rate limiting. Input size limits. Resource quotas.
